text: today I'm making an apple cobbler so to
start off with you want to make your
brown butter because that takes about
eight minutes and I have four
tablespoons of butter that I'm going to
brown butter if I just melt it and then
you cook it over like a medium
medium-low heat until the milk solids
turn a nice golden brown and that's what
you're looking for so you can turn this
off just let it sit get your apples
ready three pounds of apples I'm using
Granny Smith any kind will do cut the
Apple in approximately in eight add it
to a nice big bowl and then add a
tablespoon of lemon juice now you want
to mix together your sugars I have a
half a cup of light brown sugar one
third of a cup of granulated sugar 1/2
teaspoon of coarse salt and 1/4 cup of
all-purpose flour flowers for thickening
you can stir these ingredients together
first you're also going to add a vanilla
bean and you want to mix the vanilla in
with the sugar so that it disperses
evenly want to get your oven preheating
to 375 degrees because you're going to
precook your apple mixture before you
put your biscuit topping on so add the
sugar to the apples as well as your
brown butter and stir everything
together transfer this mixture to a 9 by
13 inch baking dish and I do that
covered with parchment and foil for
about 10 minutes in the 375 degree oven
while your apples are pre cooking make
your topping this is 2 cups of flour and
to that add 2 teaspoons of baking powder
1/2 a teaspoon of coarse salt quarter
cup of sugar give that a whisk you want
your butter cold and cut into pieces so
that you get a nice flaky biscuit this
is one stick of butter unsalted I like
to use my fingers to work this in now
what you want to do is stir in some
cream this is a cup plus 2 tablespoons
of cream don't over mix it just stir it
till all of the dry ingredients sort of
come together and then stop mixing and
go get your apples just drop your
biscuit topping right over the top of
your apples you'll make about nine
biscuits total brush with a little bit
of cream on top and then sprinkle with a
little bit of sanding sugar for Sparkle
get it right back in the oven and bake
it until it's bubbling in the center and
the biscuits are golden brown and cooked
through 55 to 65 more minutes the juices
have thickened really nicely see that
one caramelized apple that's why I took
that piece and I'm gonna get to eat it
mmm words cannot describe how happy I am
right now this is so good you guys
should really give it a try
Oh
